intro: Mesembryanthemum bellidiflorum var. simplex, commonly known as the simple bellidiflorum mesem, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptive features to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and appear in clusters, often blooming in spring. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
